required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Grappler® Interference Screw Post-Market Clinical Follow-Up Study
clinical_study.official_title: Grappler® Interference Screw Post-Market Clinical Follow-Up Study

brief_summary.textblock: Ambispective, multi-surgeon, single site, consecutive case series to determine the safety, performance, and benefits of the Grappler(R) Interference Screw.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a ambispective, multi-surgeon, single site, consecutive case series. Data collection will occur in two phases. Retrospective data collection will occur upon subject identification, and data will be collected from the site's medical records for minimum of 50 subjects who have undergone soft tissue to bone fixation with the Grappler® Interference Screw System. Data will be collected from the subjects' pre-op visits, intra-op visits, 7 week post-op follow-up visits (± 4 weeks), and 6 month post-op follow-up visits (± 4 weeks). The subject must have adequate radiographic and medical records for the minimum follow up requirement of 6 months. Prospective data collection will occur upon subject's provision of written informed consent, and data will be collected from patient reported outcomes (PRO's).

primary_outcome.description: Safety will be assessed by recording the incidence of revisions. The relationship of events will be attributed to either the implant or instrumentation.
Safety will be assessed by recording the incidence of adverse events. The relationship of events will be attributed to either the implant or instrumentation.
Safety will be assessed by recording the incidence of complications. The relationship of events will be attributed to either the implant or instrumentation.

secondary_outcome.description: Safety as related to rate of recurrence of deformity
Safety as related to rate of implant failure

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of re-tear or re-rupture of fixated soft tissue
secondary_outcome.description: Safety as related to rate of re-tear or re-rupture of fixated soft tissue
Safety as related to rate of screw removal

Device performance and benefits as related to Foot and Ankle Mobility Measure Activities of Daily Living (0-84) and sports (0-32) subscales. The higher the score, the higher the level of function, with 100% representing no dysfunction.
Device performance and benefits as related to pain levels based on the Visual Analog Scale (range: 0 to 100; 0 = no pain; 100 = worst pain imaginable)
Device performance and benefits as related to patient satisfaction (very satisfied, good, fair, not satisfied)

clinical_study.condition: Flexor Hallucis Longus on the Left
Flexor Digitorum Longus on the Left
Flexor Hallucis Longus on the Right
Flexor Digitorum Longus on the Right

intervention.description: Foot and/or ankle procedure involving soft tissue attachment to bone using the Grappler® Interference Screw System

study_pop.textblock: The investigational population will include a minimum of 50 subjects who have undergone a foot and/or ankle procedure that fulfill the eligibility criteria

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- The subject must have undergone a foot and/or ankle procedure involving soft tissue attachment to bone using the Grappler® Interference Screw System and completed by one of the designated investigators who are experienced in the use of such implants and the required specialized surgical techniques
- The subject must have adequate radiographic and medical records for the minimum follow-up requirement of six months
For the Prospective Data Collection:
- The subject is willing to provide written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- None
